column4: hey all, trying to connect to my VNC setup on my ubuntu machine at home, but it won't let me in... I've tried TightVNC, and RealVNC, both mention something about security types... anybody know of a vnc program that works for connecting to ubuntu's supplied vnc server?
any reason you cant use ssh x forwarding?
it's behind a firewall and I don't have access to it at the moment, though I could do that
there is a piece of software for windows called xMing, i was using it on XP to have remote x forwarding from windows to a gnome desktop
and that would go over the internet, not just on a LAN?
so i could use putty, setup x forwarding and loginto my ubuntu machine, then i could run anything that would normally require a x server, which xMing handles since it is an x server for windows
it's connection abilities are using ssh... so anything you can setup ssh to connect to
it was the easiest way for me to get gedit running on windows
this was when i was using dapper though
ah, i get you now, ssh into the box, forward the X11 ports
ja
cool, I'll try it when i get home
better peformance than vnc
would xMing support xdm?
but im not sure about sessions...you could incorporate the use of 'screen' in there somehwere
i dont know what xdm is
is it like gdm?
it is a blanket term for gdm and kdm for gnome and kde
the act of logging in via ssh does the same thing that you would do via gdm/kdm/xdm
once you are at the remote servers prompt, you just run stuff like : # gedit or # nautilus --no-desktop
or you could just open up the nautilus desktop .... #nautilus
a google search revealed that xMing does support XDMCP out of the box
its one of my favourit pieces of software on windows
providing you are stuck in a windows enviroment and are allowed to install xming
